title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer gives six transfer targets to Man Utd chief Ed Woodward
text:
Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has given his transfer shortlist to Manchester United’s hierarchy (Getty Images)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has given six transfer recommendations to Manchester United’s executive vice-chairman Ed Woodward, according to reports.

United are looking to strengthen in the January transfer window following a poor start to the Premier League season.

Solskjaer has already admitted that he is keen to strengthen his options with a new striker in January having allowed both Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez to leave Old Trafford in the summer.

And according to the Mail on Sunday, Solskjaer, along with his assistant Mike Phelan and scout Jim Lawlor, have proposed six potential signings to Woodward ahead of the upcoming transfer window.

Ed Woodward is looking to adopt a more patient approach in the transfer market (Getty Images)

But the report claims that United’s hierarchy ‘prefer to wait until the summer’ to sign key players after the mistake they made with Sanchez’s transfer last year.

United are now said to be willing to adopt a more patient approach in the transfer market, taking lessons from Liverpool’s six-month pursuit of Virgil van Dijk.

Earlier this week, reports in Italy claimed that United already have a verbal agreement in place to sign Mario Mandzukic in January.

The 33-year-old, who has not made an appearance for Juventus this season, came close to joining United in the summer before the club pulled out of the transfer.

United have also reportedly opened talks with Barcelona to discuss a potential deal for Ivan Rakitic.
